result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Stewart L Herrera was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Stewart L Herrera was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Stewart L Herrera was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must install IID on all vehicles titled in his name and upon issuance of valid drivers license.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not possess any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter into any bars/taverns , beer tents or establishments that sell alcohol.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.
$713.50 (count 1 in 15CM04) to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in count 3 in case 15CM04.

defendant.name: Herrera, Stewart L
defendant.address: P.O. Box 91, 5592 Kwe da Kik Court, Crandon, WI 54520

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Stewart L Herrera in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Defendant Stewart L Herrera in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge William Kussel appears from Shawano County Courtroom, via video. Called 3:57 PM. Here for sentencing after revocation. State - has reviewed revocation packet, 110 credit days jail credit, makes final argument and asks for 4 months in the FC jail on each count (#3 & #6) to run consecutive to each other. Laska makes final argument and states there is a time discrepency for jail credit, she feels there is 125 days and asks 3 month for each count to be served concurrently, fine of $1000 to be paid in response to #3. Herrera makes statement, remorseful. Court has reviewed file and revocation paperwork. Court sentences the defendant to the following: Count 3 & 6 -  4 months in FC jail, consecutive, credit for 110 days, right to appeal. Laska asks for huber privieliges. Court orders huber, eligible for good time and community service. Adjourned 4:09 PM.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 16, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Motion for Sentencing Revocation Hearing by Video Conference - clerk sent copy to Judge Kussel and his JA

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Request/Agreement for Modification to Conditions of Probation - 60 days of jail without huber.

Defendant Stewart L Herrera in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:54 AM. Also called 15CM38. Burns - resolved - offer attached to plea questionnaire - 15CM04 - joint recommendation that the defendant would be pleading to #1 as alleged, 5 days jail, $1379.00 fine inclusive, 12 month DL suspension, IID, AODA assessment; plead to #3 and #6 as alleged - joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: court costs only on each count, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, tavrrns, liquor stores or establishments that sell alcohol, employment/school, 50 hours of community service, counts #2, #4 and #5 - DRI; 15CM38 - joint recommnendation to DRI counts #2 and #3 - amend #1 to county ordinance of obstructing with a forfeiture of $500 plus costs. State agrees - defendant needs to acknowledge one prior conviction of OWI and moves to amendments as stated by Burns. Herrara will plead NC to counts #1, #3 and #6 as alleged on 15CM04. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2, #4 and #5 on 15CM04. Court - 15CM38 - amends count #1 to county ordinance of obstructing - pleads NC - finds G - fine of $500.00 plus costs totalling $834.50 - take bond posted from this case and move bond from 15CM04 to pay this fine entirely and transfer remaining bond to 15CM04. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2 and #3. Burns acknowledges 1 prior OWI conviction. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendations. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Herrera makes statement - requests jail credit of 1 day on 15CM04 and 22 days on 15CM38 and apply that credit to 15CM04. State argues - no legal basis - will stipulate to 1 day credit on 15CM04. Court responds - does not believe it can apply the 22 days to 15CM04. Burns responds. Court will allow counsel the ability to research the jail credit and then asks for time to report while research is being completed. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CM04 - count #1 - 5 days in FC jail - report by no later than 8:30 AM on 8/14/15 - 1 day credit - huber allowed, fine of $1379.00 inclusive of costs - take bond posted and remainder due thru probation on remaining counts, 12 month DL revocation, IID for 12 months on DL and any vehicle titled in his name, AODA; counts #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year - concurrent to each other, with conditions of: costs on each count - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns beer tents or establishments that sell alcohol, maintain full time employment, 50 hours of community service total, DNA surcharge on both counts - paid thru probation, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant Stewart L Herrera in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:44 PM. Burns has both complaints, waives reading of them and enters NG pleas to all counts. court continues bond, accepts pleas, set both matters for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Called 10:00 am. Attorney Mary Burns appears on behalf of defendant. No appearance by Herrera. State appears by Charles Simono. Burns provides court with "request for substitution". Court accepts substitution.

Defendant Stewart L Herrera in court appearing via video from FOSO with attorney Jeffery Joy appears telephonically.  Defendant Stewart L Herrera in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:53 PM. Also called 15CM38. Herrera thought he had SPD representation. Joy responds, thought he was going to be privately retained. Mary Burns was here from SPD. Court instructs defendant to contact SPD and Ms. Burns happens to be in the FOSO at this point, Court allows Joy to withdraw from the case, continues bond, set for AIA on both cases.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Stewart L Herrera in court, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:26 PM. Also called 15CM38. Herrera states he does not have either complaint. Court reads charges and penalties for both cases and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Herrera understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, believes he is eligible for SPD. Court sets for AIA. Herrera asks for signature bond for stated reasons (warrants in Shawano and Milwaukee County). State - bond - significant cash bond for stated reasons. Court - bond - 15CM04 - $1000 cash bond, no consumption of alcohol. Court - bond - 15CM38 - continues bond of $500 cash and set for same date and time.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 10:45 am.

Return on warrant/Initial appearance at 03-11-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Stewart L Herrera not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:39 AM. State - mailed S&C to last known address and not returned, asks for bench warrant, body or $1000.00. Court so orders.
No consumption of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns.
